Package org.cpnsim.statemanager

Class PartitionRangesManager

java.lang.Object
org.cpnsim.statemanager.PartitionRangesManager
public class PartitionRangesManager extends Object
A class to manage the partition ranges in the datacenter. Note that the partition here refers to the logical partition, mainly for the convenience of the IntraScheduler to synchronize the state of the hosts in the region on a regional basis
Since:
CPNSim 1.0
Author:
Jiawen Liu

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    (package private) int
    hostNum
    The number of hosts in the datacenter
    org.slf4j.Logger
    LOGGER
    The Logger of the class
    (package private) int[]
    rangeId
    An array to store the partition id of the ranges in the datacenter.
    (package private) int[]
    rangePart
    An array to store the start of the ranges of the partitions in the datacenter.
    (package private) TreeMap<Integer,int[]>
    ranges
    The ranges of the partitions in the datacenter The key is the partition id, and the value is the range of the partition The range is represented by an array of two integers, the first integer is the start of the range, and the second integer is the end of the range For example, if the partition id is 0, and the range is [0, 2], then the partition 0 includes the hosts with id 0, 1, 2

  • Field Details

    • ranges

      TreeMap<Integer,int[]> ranges
      The ranges of the partitions in the datacenter The key is the partition id, and the value is the range of the partition The range is represented by an array of two integers, the first integer is the start of the range, and the second integer is the end of the range For example, if the partition id is 0, and the range is [0, 2], then the partition 0 includes the hosts with id 0, 1, 2

    • rangePart

      int[] rangePart
      An array to store the start of the ranges of the partitions in the datacenter. for example, if the ranges are [0, 2], [3, 5], [6, 8], then the array is [0, 3, 6] The aim of this array is to find the partition id of a host id quickly

    • rangeId

      int[] rangeId
      An array to store the partition id of the ranges in the datacenter. for example, if the ranges are [0, 2], [3, 5], [6, 8], then the array is [0, 1, 2] It corresponds to ranges. The aim of this array is to find the partition id of a host id quickly

    • hostNum

      int hostNum
      The number of hosts in the datacenter

    • LOGGER

      public org.slf4j.Logger LOGGER
      The Logger of the class

      endIndex - the end id of the datacenter
